p:
In addition to Eq. 1, our preferred specification, we investigate the effects of several alternate specifications. Specifically we first investigate whether newer studies (publication date of 2005 or later) give a different temperature response compared to the full sample; second investigate the effect of individual agronomic adaptations, specifically changing cultivar and planting date; third allow the effect of temperature to differ depending on whether the study was a process-based or empirical study; fourth add a
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$\Delta T_{ijk}^3$$\end{document}
Δ
T
i j k
3
term in the specification; and finally perform F-tests on individual terms within the model. These findings are documented in the SI (Supplementary Figs 18– 20, Supplementary Tables 6 and 7). They do not substantially alter our estimates of the yield response to climate change.
